content: Investments Retirement Robo-Advisors Asked by AnonymousAsked on 09 May 2019Is there a chance if the robo-advisor shut down? (e.g. StashAway)?Planning to setup a savings/retirement account with StashAway. What are the chances of them shutting down etc?2 answersAnswerBump1
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Gabriel Tham, Kenichi Tag Team Member at Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Any company face the same risk, even SG banks. But as long as our investments are kept seperate and custodised, it should be safer. https://www.stashaway.sg/faq/115003747047-what-happens-to-my-money-if-stashaway-gets-acquired-goes-public-or-closes/1 comment2

Bryan C.Level 2. RookieAnswered 2w agoHi Anon!I think that any bank will face that risk but often, robo-advisors have their client's investments kept with their custodian banks. For Kristal.AI, they partner with Interactive Brokers and Saxo Capital Markets to facilitate the investment activities related to the different types of Investment Accounts a client may have. You can visit their website at  https://solutions.kristal.ai/seedlypost1 comment1
